articles.description: Aston Villa beat Hibernian 5-0 in the Europa Conference League, Arsenal's Nicolas Pepe will reportedly move to Saudi Arabia, plus Premier League news conferences.
articles.title: Reaction to Aston Villa's win plus transfers latest

articles.description: Courtney Lawes will captain England on his 100th cap in Saturday's match with Fiji at Twickenham, while hooker Theo Dan makes his first start.
articles.title: Lawes to captain England on 100th cap against Fiji

articles.description: Wolves reject a £47m offer from Manchester City for Portugal midfielder Matheus Nunes.
articles.title: Wolves reject bid from Man City for Nunes

articles.description: Great Britain's Josh Kerr says he "threw 16 years in the sport at the final 200m" to beat Jakob Ingebrigtsen to world 1500m gold.
articles.title: 'I threw 16 years in the sport at the last 200m'

articles.description: Watch the moment Great Britain's Josh Kerr holds off a challenge from favourite Jakob Ingebrigtsen to win gold in the world 1500m final.
articles.title: 'Lightning strikes twice!' - GB's Kerr wins 1500m gold

articles.description: In his BBC Sport column, Steve Bunce says heavyweight Daniel Dubois needs more than a 'puncher’s chance’ to dethrone champion Oleksandr Usyk in Poland on Saturday.
articles.title: 'Dubois can't just rely on puncher’s chance’

articles.description: American John Isner, who has served a record 14,411 aces, announces he will retire after the US Open following a 17-year career.
articles.title: Ace record holder Isner to retire after US Open

articles.description: A union representing Spain forward Jennifer Hermoso, who was kissed on the lips by Spanish football federation president Luis Rubiales, says the incident should not go unpunished.
articles.title: 'Rubiales kiss should not go unpunished'

articles.description: Watch highlights as Aston Villa thump Hibernian 5-0 at Easter Road in the first leg of their Europa Conference League play-off tie.
articles.title: Watch best of the action as Villa overwhelm Hibs

articles.description: Listen to Southern Brave bowler Tymal Mills reaction on the player microphone as he takes the wicket of Manchester Originals' Phil Salt in The Hundred at Old Trafford.
articles.title: 'Catch it!' - Mills takes wicket while on player mic
